alert.note: Alert for Bay; Midland; Saginaw (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 16 at 9:02PM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...AN AREA OF HEAVY SNOW SHOWERS AFFECTING BAY...SAGINAW...AND MIDLAND COUNTIES... HAZARDS...An area of heavy snow showers capable of low visibility and high snow rate. Visibility near a quarter of a mile is possible at times along with snow rate near 1 inch per hour. Slick roads are likely, especially bridges and overpasses from the US-10 corridor southward. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 858 PM EST, the area of heavy snow extended along and north of a line from near St. Louis to near Saginaw to Quanicassee and moving southeast at 20 MPH. THIS AREA OF HEAVY SNOW WILL BE NEAR... Zilwaukee around 910 PM EST. Saginaw around 915 PM EST. Bridgeport around 920 PM EST. Merrill around 930 PM EST. Frankenmuth around 955 PM EST. St. Charles around 1005 PM EST. Birch Run around 1100 PM EST. This includes the following highways... I-75 between mile markers 134 and 185. I-675 between mile markers 1 and 7. US-10 between mile markers 102 and 139. SAFETY INFO... Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
